meanings.definition: To secure a loan with collateral.
meanings.sent1: She had to collateralize her car to get the loan.
meanings.sent2: He decided to collateralize his house for the mortgage.
meanings.sent3: The bank asked him to collateralize his pet goldfish for the loan.
meanings.sent4: In a risky move, he chose to collateralize his prized possessions.
meanings.sent5: To ensure the loan, she had to collateralize her jewelry collection.

meanings.definition: To provide collateral for a loan.
meanings.sent1: They were willing to collateralize their savings account for the business loan.
meanings.sent2: She had to collateralize her artwork to secure the loan.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly offered to collateralize his collection of comic books for the loan.
meanings.sent4: In a bold move, they decided to collateralize their antique furniture.
meanings.sent5: To get the loan approved, he had to collateralize his rare stamp collection.
